100352.name: Drowned!
100352.description:
From Introduction:

This short adventure is bonus content for the Barbary adventure zone book. As such, it details and interesting feature of that region in the Untamed Empires world, together with a plot to encourage roleplay around it. The "Unwanted Passenger" section is suitable for a group of four 150K characters, but if you follow some of the later suggestions it's easy to scale up the difficulty to include a whole ship of enemies. What we're talking about here is nothing less than the dead walking the islands off the Barbary coast...

100353.name: De Fabeltjeskrant 2
100353.description:
User Summary

De Fabeltjeskrant is a Dutch children's animation TV-series that was broadcasted for several decades in The Netherlands. In this (partially educational) video game (four mini games) you play with several caracters that feature the television series.

100354.name: Powers & Worlds
100354.description:
From Introduction:

Powers and Worlds is a bit of an anecdotal behind-the-scenes documentary mixed in with a "how to" guidebook. We'd been asked by the fans to give some help in designing Pulse-wielding powers in various settings, and it was something we really wanted to help out with. But wow! What a tall order! Of all the magic in all the worlds - how could we tackle such a huge task?

While creating the Weapons and Worlds list, the answer came to us; we'd do it the same way - by example. And that's how Powers and Worlds came about. Over the years of play testing different settings with the second edition Suzerain rules, we'd designed over a thousand feats, many of them Pulse powers. By taking some of those examples and talking about them, we hope you get a feel for the ways in which you can develop your own. We only scratch the surface in these pages - the rest is up to you!

100355.name: Pajama Sam: No Need To Hide When It's Dark Outside
100355.description:
Pajama Sam: No Need To Hide When It's Dark Outside is a 1996 children's point-and-click adventure game originally released for PC and Mac. The first game of the Pajama Sam franchise, it features the titular character entering the "Land of Darkness" through his closet to capture Darkness himself and recover his superhero gear, which has been scattered throughout the land.

This game was first released on May 31, 1996.

On August 19, 2008, the game was re-released as a Wii game by Majesco Entertainment renamed as Pajama Sam: Don't Fear The Dark.

Source: Wikipedia, "Pajama Sam In: No Need To Hide When It's Dark Outside," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

100356.name: Relic Combat Primer
100356.description:
From Introduction:

This short book is an introduction to combat in the fantasy world of Relic, a primer if you will. That's why it's called the Relic Combat Primer. I'm going to talk about some of the important concepts for using the Suzerain rules in a fantasy setting, give you the stats on some new weapons and armor, and throw a few feats at your characters. The ones who solve problems with a sword or bow, and there's plenty of call for them in such a place, will thank me...until I point out that the enemy gets access to all of the same feats, any time your director wants. Nobody said it's easy being an adventurer.

100358.description:
The Builder is a new Action card for Jerusalem.

Just add the card to the basic Action card deck to play with it.

If you play this card, you spend two Bezant coins to the Bank and receive 3 Prestige points.
100358.name: Jerusalem: The Builder

100359.description:
The Assassin is a new Action card for Jerusalem.

Just add the card to the basic Action card deck to play with it.

If you play this card, you spend two Bezant coins and you can kill one Squire to an opponent even if it's protected by a Baron. The dead Squire goes back to general reserve.
100359.name: Jerusalem: The Assassin

100360.name: The Long Plains Posse
100360.description:
User summary:

A collection of pregen PCs based on Gamescapes: Story Cards, Western Set 2.

100361.name: Dualism
100361.description:
Dualism is a fascinating puzzle game about polarity. It features 160 levels ranging from easy to hard.

Dualism requires an iPad with iOS 4.2 or higher.

You draw one continuous line on the board and each stone the line touches, will switch its color. Black to white and vice versa.

To finish a level you have to make sure each stone in each row has the same color. But be aware, different rows can have different colors!

Dualism features over 160 challenging levels. 100 levels are included for free. Enough to keep you hooked for hours.

A 10 level tutorial is included, so you can learn to play Dualism hands on.

Dualism is Game Center enabled, so you can share all your solved levels with your friends online!

Source: The Game Website.

100362.name: Doom's Knight
100362.description:
You’ve been punitively posted to Mars after assaulting your commanding officer, who ordered your unit to fire upon civilians. The Martian marine base acts as security for AGM corporation (AGM), a multi-planetary conglomerate, which is performing secret experiments with teleportation by creating gateways between the two moons of Mars, Phobos and Deimos.

Phobos is considered by space marines to be the dullest assignment imaginable: "with no action for eighty million miles, your day consisted of suckin' sand and watchin' flicks in the rec room." This all changes when the AGM experiments go horribly wrong.

Computer systems on Phobos malfunction, Deimos disappears entirely, and "something fragging evil" starts pouring out of the gateway, killing or possessing all AGM personnel. Responding to a frantic distress call from the overrun scientists, the Martian marine unit is quickly sent to Phobos to investigate, where you’re left to guard the hangar with only a pistol while the rest of the group proceeds inside. Over the course of the next few hours, you hear assorted garbled radio messages, gunfire, and screams, followed by silence: "Seems your buddies are dead…or WORSE…"

As the last man standing, your mission is to fight through the entire onslaught of demonic enemies by yourself in order to keep them from attacking Earth.


*** *** ***




If you liked Doom, you'd like Doom's Knight. All new 36 new levels and new sound track will put you in the middle of the action.

Features:
- 36 new levels
- 9 weapons: Fists, Pistol, Shotgun, Chain gun, Rocket Launcher, Plasma Gun, saw, Shotgun, and BFG
- Multiplayer via Wi-Fi
- New soundtrack

Source: The Developer Website.

100363.name: TowerMadness
100363.description:
Evil aliens are coming to turn your beloved sheep into intergalactic scarves! Protect the flock using only quick thinking and the arsenal of upgradeable weaponry at your disposal.

TowerMadness is an epic 3D Tower Defense Strategy Game featuring:


3D graphics with multitouch pan and zoom, so you can view the action from your favorite angle
Meticulously crafted and polished gameplay
Challenging path-finding enemy AI
16 enemy types
9 weapon types with 5 upgrades each (Plasmatron, Laser Cannon, Railgun, Mortar, Guided Missiles, Flak, ElectroSlow, ElectroShock, and ElectroBoost), and an ultimate weapon – the Nuke!
30+ maps in diverse environments (forest, desert, snow, and more!)
Endless Mode: See how many waves you can withstand!


Source: The Game Website.

100364.name: Alien Invaders
100364.description:
The Earth is under attack.

As the last hope of the planet, you have to destroy the Alien fleet.

Prepare yourself for a classic style game now in your iPhone/iPad/iPod Touch!

GAME FEATURES (1.5):

You can improve your robot weapons with the shop between levels!
High Resolution Graphics for iPhone 4 / iPad.
A new look for classic shoot'em up.
3D graphics.
Online Scores.
20 Levels.
2 Control modes: Accelerometer/VirtualPad.
Autosave feature.




Source: The Game Website.

100365.name: Alien Invaders 2
100365.description:
If the hundreds of thousands of earthlings who destroyed your ships during the first Alien Invaders battle left you wanting more, here comes the mother of all battles - “Alien Invaders: Second Wave”.

Earthling, use your adrenaline for the good of humanity. Get on board your combat Mech and show off your skills in total space war against the alien invaders who are trying to take over and destroy the earth.

Enormous motherships and endless combat raiders will test your piloting skills to the very limit.

Use all the resources your combat Mech can offer, combine multiple plasma blasts with the destructive power of missiles, or use the triple laser to strike your enemies, and resist attack with an energy shield.

You are not alone in this battle; help is coming to fight the aliens. Thanks to the Bluetooth connection you can join forces with a friend and finish off the invaders.

This frenzied shoot 'em up has cutting edge 3D graphics for your iPhone/iPod/iPad and a spectacular soundtrack, as well as perfect playability and control to give you a taste of pure adrenaline.

GAME FEATURES:
- Intense 3D action—Amazing 3D graphics.
- Infinite playability. Once you finish the game, play again! The difficulty will increase!
- Online scores.
- Weapons Arsenal.
- Control modes: Accelerometer and Touch control.
- Level autosave feature.

Source: The Game Website.

100366.name: Jump Pack
100366.description:
Jump Pack is a highly addictive game like no other. Jump, hop and fly your way to the top while beating enemies and collecting insane power-ups.

You'll find power-ups that speed up time, give a "spring loaded" jump and fill up your jet pack with rocket fuel for a MEGA BLAST.

There's enemies trying to stop your every move, so make sure you land on top of them instead of jumping into them!

While playing Jump Pack HD, you'll be collecting gems. You can upgrade your characters clothes, armor and weapons with these gems at any time. Pick from over 16,000,000 colors… create a lady in pink or a dark knight. It's all up to you.

Source: The Game Website.

100367.name: Derelicts of Sin: Heresy
100367.description:
Derelicts of Sin: Heresy is the first in a series of games revolving around the Derelicts of Sin and the dark past of the Theocratic Council.

Heresy revolves around Kyle Mason, the sole survivor of a terrible act of sabotage. Hoping to find oxygen before he asphyxiates, Kyle limps his sabotaged ship into a forbidden Cursed Zone called "the Wreckage." There, he boards one of the Derelicts of Sin, the Heresy, desperate to find the supplies he needs to survive and return home.

This solo game seeks to recreate the feel of classic text-based adventures. The player takes on the role of engineer Kyle Mason. Oxygen is used as action points to move, open locked doors, restore power, etc. The player begins on the Airlock tile. As he or she explores the ship, additional tiles are drawn randomly and added to the ship. These tiles provide instructions on how to further advance, reveal the items that can be found in the new room, and detail the the puzzle(s), if any, that must be solved in order to win the game.

In the current version, a player sheet is used to track the player's physical and mental states (which affect the player's ability to search the ship and perform various actions), as well as the player's oxygen level and inventory. Another optional version is in development that will use chart tiles and tokens to track these things.

As the player explores the ship, he or she will find data cards that gradually reveal the terrible fate of the Heresy and its passengers and crew. They also provide victory points that are key to obtaining the specific ending a player desires. Without sufficient victory points, players will lose when they end the game, so it's important to find as many data cards as possible.

This game was developed as part of the Solitaire Print-and-Play Contest at http://boardgamegeek.com/thread/644090/solitaire-print-and-p....

100369.name: Tick Sheet & Counters
100369.description:
User summary:

A sheet and counters for tracking the Suzerain initiative system.

100370.name: Ash
100370.description:
These are strange days for Aghaus. By order of the Magistrate, the Royal Guard is to assemble for deployment in two days’ time. It has been years since I last left the capital, and further still that I can remember such a command being issued! But what need is there for a Royal Guard, when no King sits upon the throne? Though my oath binds me to his service, the Magistrate is not my liege. He rules in the absence of a rightful heir.

My men await their orders; they too are uneasy. It is for their sake that I stay my tongue, and place my faith in the Almighty that my fears are unfounded.

Tomorrow, we make for the East.

–Captain Creval of the Royal Guard, in the 895th year of our Empire

18 months in the making, Ash, SRRN’s full length RPG for the iPhone and iPod Touch is finally ready for release.

Designed exclusively for the iPhone, Ash is an original turn-based RPG, featuring an all-new, intuitive touch-based interface, lush visuals licensed from Enterbrain, beautifully orchestrated music, and a wonderfully compelling story.

Ash tells the story of two mercenaries on the fringes of the Empire of Aghaus, a once-great kingdom now fallen into ruin after the death of its king five years prior. When a routine contract takes an unexpected turn, the two men are gradually embroiled in a conflict that consumes the entire continent—and brings to light the mercenaries’ mysterious pasts.

Source: The Game Website.

100371.name: Weapons and Worlds
100371.description:
User summary:

A collection of weapons for varying time periods intended for use in Suzerain campaigns.

100372.name: Astro Fire
100372.description:
AstroFire is a classic asteroid-blasting arcade action game, featuring fully rendered 3D graphics and 18 different types of enemy craft, spread over 75 action-packed levels.

Requires: Windows 98, 2000, Me or XP.

AstroFire can be run on newer operating systems (Windows 7, Vista, Mac OS X, Linux, etc) using DOSBox.

Source: The Game Website.

100373.name: Savage Suzerain: Play Now, For Free!
100373.description:
From publisher blurb:

Not sure whether you want your characters to be a pantheon in the making? Before you invest in some major gaming pleasure…

Play now, for free!

Product Contains: A 98 page full color, hi-resolution PDF. It is a large download file and art intensive. Inside are 24 pre-generated character sheets for six characters at four power levels, plus all the universe background and game rules needed to play those characters at any of the power levels. There’s also a detailed description of how those characters were made from our resident Savage Worlds guru, Alan Bundock and five One Sheet adventures to get your GM started.

For the full Suzerain experience using Savage Worlds, try the ‘big book’ of Savage Suzerain, which includes an expanded set of player material, a full plot-point campaign, other scenarios, and some universe secrets!

100374.name: Atlantida
100374.description:
Game Overview

In Atlantida you control a faction of the people of Atlantis that, after a series of catastrophes that turn their once glorious civilization to a semi-barbaric state, must move to the safety of the continent to avoid perish in the island inevitable collapse.
There are 13 turns, in which you must explore the island to gather resources, develop your city and discover technologies and advances in order to be able to send your population to safety. The winner is the first to save all her people or the most efficient to save them in the moment the island collapses.

Game Development

Even though the Atlantida already works as intended and the general idea is defined, it is still subject to changes. The game was developed directly for the yucata.de website, aiming to benefit from multiple plays which can provide a fair amount of players' feedback and suggestions. It is possible to play it "live", though, using the print and play files and rules at the Files section.

100375.name: Air-musement Park
100375.description:
In Air-musement Park the ride through the amusement park can be played alone or with others. Single players can work through each maze to improve their skills and improve their time. With multiple players, time each player's attempt and the player with the best time wins! If the player loses air control of the ball, the player must start over. Players can physically move around
each maze as they manipulate the ball through each challenge run; however, the player can not touch or move the maze itself.

100376.name: Color Connection Maze
100376.description:
Game where math skills, color blending, critical thinking and fast-paced, finger-flicking fun meet.

This intriguing game is a fun way for children to explore combinations and blends of colors. For example, by shifting the yellow and blue levers, they guide a marble into the green slot. By shifting the red, yellow and white levers, they guide a marble into the peach slot. To win, all slots must be filled with two marbles of matching colors. It's a great test of visual tracking, mental aerobics and hand-eye coordination.

Contents:

1 Plastic game board




(with 32 marbles, 2 plastic legs
and wind-up timer)

100377.description: It is the Italian version of The Wicked Munchkin Die that besides the D10 Wicked Dice and the Bag includes 20 cards in Italian. Part of the cards are translation of promo cards and partly unique Italian cards like the Maledition "Tretatre Trentini".
100377.name: Munchkin 4.5

100378.name: Green Gators
100378.description:
This silly word game includes 80 game cards. Players take turns describing the object (noun) on each card without saying the word on the card. The first person that guesses the correct word wins the card. When a player gets a card with a green alligator they give clues to the other players to help them guess the activity (verb) the alligator is doing. The person who correctly
guesses the most cards wins.

100380.name: Pool Party
100380.description:
The object of Pool Party game is to be the first player to bring their frogs (disks) into a row, starting from the smaller inner circle next to the island and continuing in a straight line out to the largest circle is the winner. Which frolicking frog will be first to hop in and form a row in the pool? Only the dice can say. This suspenseful game encourages kids to call on their thinking, basic math and social skills.

Contents:

1 Game board
30 Frogs (disks)




(Each disk size is in 6 colors: red, blue, green, purple, orange, yellow)
5 Large disks (1-3/16")
5 Semi-large disks (1-1/16")
5 Medium disks (7/8")
5 Semi-medium disks (13/16")
5 Small disks (19/32")

2 Standard 6-sided dice

100382.name: What's Different? Matching game
100382.description:
Look carefully! These images are very similar and as players match picture cards to them they develop concentration, observation, and critical thinking skills. Players match the picture cards with the pictures on their boards. The quickest player is the winner.

Contents:

4 Game boards




1 Balls game board
1 Cat game board
1 Clown game board
1 Tomato game board

36 Lotto picture cards




9 Balls lotto cards
9 Cat lotto cards
9 Clown lotto cards
9 Tomato lotto cards

1 Check sheet

100383.name: Tormenta (Issue 9 - Feb 2002)
100383.description:
Table of Contents

2 - Gorendill The Thieves' Guild
4 - Urban Heroes
12 - Water Tirants
18 - New Feats
22 - Gods Realms
30 - Necromancer Answers

100384.name: Virtua Tennis 4
videogamehonor: 2011 Spike Best Sports Game of the Year Nominee
100384.description:
"Virtua Tennis 4 (Sega Professional Tennis: Power Smash 4 in Japan) is the third sequel to Sega's tennis game franchise, Virtua Tennis. It was released on PlayStation 3, Xbox 360 and Wii, but it has also upcoming releases on PC and PlayStation Vita. Virtua Tennis 4 is the first numbered game of the series without an arcade release."

Source: Wikipedia, "Virtua Tennis 4", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

100385.name: Beijing 2008
100385.description:
"Beijing 2008 is the official Olympic video game of the 2008 Summer Olympics held in Beijing. Developed by Eurocom and published by Sega, the game was the second video game based on the 2008 Summer Olympics to be released, the first being the fantasy-based Mario & Sonic at the Olympic Games which appeared in late 2007; however, Beijing 2008 is a realistic sports simulation.

Beijing 2008 features 32 national teams and 38 events.In addition, a career mode similar to that seen in Sydney 2000 returned, and for the first time in Olympic video games, an online mode is included."

Source: Wikipedia, "Beijing 2008 (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

100386.name: Crayolino
100386.description:
Unique charade card game where the players have to throw a dice and then depending of the number that comes up have the possibility to have drawn the same amount of pictures to figure out whats on the other players card.
The dice rolls... and it is a «2»! The player has the right to 2 drawings in order to make you guess by association of ideas, the object drawn on his card.

Contents:

100 cards featuring 600 objects in all,
5 pads of paper,
5 pencils
2 special dice.

100388.name: Boa
100388.description: The player throws the 3 dices . If he obtains the combination "B.O.A" he wins cards to enlarge his snake. The largest Boa wins

100389.name: Fosfofou
100389.description:
A luminous observation game: The cards all look the same at first glance, so it's not so easy to pair them up.

Object of the game is create as many pairs as You can. Players mix the cards then place them on the table with the "5 geometric forms" side facing upwards. All the players play at the same time. Once the signal is given, each player looks at the cards and tries to find identical pairs. As soon as a player thinks he has created a pair, he takes two cards, places them in front of him and continues to search for other pairs. But watch out for mistakes as the cards are very similar!In fact, all the cards contain the 5 same geometric shapes; only their location differs from one card to the other. You are not allowed to touch the cards except to finally take them!

Game ends when there are no more cards in the centre of the table, or it does not seem possible to create another pair (if the players have taken incorrect pairs), each player checks the pairs that he has created. Winner is the player with the most correct pairs.

Components:

48 luminous cards

100390.name: PlayStation Vita
videogamehwversion: Crystal White Hatsune Miku 3G/WiFi PlayStation Vita
100390.description:
"The PlayStation Vita (also known as PSVita or PSV) is an upcoming handheld game console under development by Sony Computer Entertainment.It is the successor to the PlayStation Portable as part of the PlayStation family of gaming devices.

The handheld includes two analog sticks, a 5-inch OLED multi-touch capacitive touchscreen, and supports Bluetooth, Wi-Fi and 3G in some models. Internally, the Vita features a 4 core ARM Cortex-A9 core processor and a 4 core SGX543MP4+ graphics processing unit, as well as LiveArea as its main user interface, which succeeds the XrossMediaBar.

A main feature is full backwards-compatibility with all PlayStation Portable games that were digitally released on the PlayStation Network, via the the PlayStation Store. The device's dual analog sticks will be supported in only select games. The system will also upscale and smooth the graphics via a software emulator."

Source: Wikipedia, "PlayStation Vita", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

100391.name: Invaders World Tour 3
100391.description:
"Defend the planet from an onslaught of extra-terrestrial invaders with the release of Appular’s Invaders World Tour 3, for iPhone, iPod touch and iPad. In the game, countries all over the world have witnessed a surge in extra-terrestrial activity with appearances of worm-holes and alien life-forms in the sky. The United States, Canada, Europe and China have collectively gone up in arms to defend against what seems to be a hostile takeover, and are asking players join the fight for humanity!"

Source: The Developer Website.

100392.name: Air Hockey
100392.description:
"With the option for 1 or 2 pucks, this 1 and 2-player air hockey favorite is a blast for young & old alike! This is the only air hockey that lets you play with 2 pucks at once!

If you're alone, play a computer opponent ranging from easy to INSANE! Get a friend and grab your mallets to see who dominates the table in 2-player mode. Try off the wall banks & combos to spoil your opponent's defenses and be the first to score 7 points - just like in real air hockey!

You'll play with easy to control mallets that aren't too big or small and a puck that rockets across the table. The goals are sized to perfectly balance rapid game play and the challenge of the game. Advanced physics and air hockey sounds make the game act and sound like you're playing on a real table!

Air Hockey has wireless multiplayer for across-the-room fun. It also includes 12 OpenFeint leaderboards and 1000 OpenFeint Achievement Points. "

Source: The Developer Website.

100393.name: Zed by Dawn
100393.description:
The world as you knew it has collapsed, flesh eating horrors from your worst nightmares walk the earth, and you're low on ammo..

Welcome to Zed by Dawn.

Object:
Zed by Dawn is a print-and-play solo survival horror dice and card game in the world of Zed Run!!! Before the Citystates, before the Gameshow, there were survivors that tirelessly fought the undead hordes; ZbD pits you against a world gone mad.

Zbd's Combat system requires the player to meet or exceed a number of successes that match the encounters target number, using a custom set of six-sided dice.

Each roll whether it be all six dice or just one die will use the survivors precious resources, Fatigue is use to perform melee attacks, ammo is used to perform ranged attacks and if your survivor is ever out of these resources, they cannot use the matching weapon.

Weapons will lower the needed number of successes to defeat encounters.

Items will be used to replenish your survivors resource pools.

Events encountered will hinder your advancement.

Survive to draw the last card in the ZbD deck and made it through the night. But what will tomorrow bring.

You must manage your resources, acquire supplies, and defeat an endless army of the walking dead; your only goal is to survive.

What you need to play
72 ZbD Cards
6 Survivor Cards
3 Resource Tracking dice (d20)
6 Combat dice (d6)

100394.name: Spel! (Jaargang 14, nr 2 - dec 2010)
rpgissuearticle: De Anatomische Les - Deel 4: Geheime Genootschappen
Den Vaderland Getrouwe - Deel 4: Geheime Genootschappen
Niet Stuk te Krijgen: De Kolonisten van Catan
Saipan & Tinian, Island War Series, Volume 1
100394.description:
Spel!
Jaargang 14, nr 2, december 2011
(Year 14, Issue 2, December 2011)

Contents:

Algemeen (General)

Voorwoord
Op bezoek bij... FORUM-Federatie
Spellenprijzen
Ducosimpagina's
Bevriende Winkels/Colofon




Beurzenspecial (Convention special)

Duzi
SPIEL '10 (part 1 to 4)

SPIEL '10 in beeld




Bordspellen (Board games)

Niet Stuk te Krijgen: De Kolonisten van Catan
Era of Inventions
Raindropchess
Snow Tails
Het Koopmanshuis
Fresco

Sporen op Tafel - deel 18
Carson City

Fürstenfeld




Bordwargames (Board wargames)

Saipan & Tinian, Island War Series, Volume 1
Kawanakajima 1561




Miniaturenwargames (Miniatures wargames)

Kings of War
De miniaturen van Mantic Games
Het Tinnen Soldaatje
Plastic
High Octane




Rollenspellen (Role-playing games)

De Anatomische Les - deel 4
Den Vaderland Getrouwe - deel 4
Van Kerkers en Draken - deel 6




Verzamelspellen (Collectable games)

MagicMania: Scars of Mirrodin
World of Warcraft TCG




Note: the page count of the magazine includes the front cover (which is page 1). Articles start at page 2.

100395.name: Pirate Polo
100395.description: Pirate Polo is a frantic live-action game for 2 - 4 "pirates". The game is played using a mini-trampoline as the playing surface. Each player has 5 dice of a single, unique color. In the center of the mini-trampoline is set a heavy, non-fragile cereal bowl. The players space themselves evenly around the mini-trampoline and place all five of their dice on the game surface in front of them. Each player has a polo mallet (at times also known as a serving spoon). On the starting signal, all players strike underneath the mini-trampoline with their polo mallet to try to propel their dice into the bowl. The first player to get all 5 dice in the bowl is the winner. This game is an alternative to the difficult to obtain Piratenbillard.

100397.name: Imperial Marines
100397.description:
User summary:

57 15mm full-color front and back sided folding miniatures plus a number of small counters with full color weapons.

From the Instruction sheet:

Full-color miniatures for all your games...with no bending, breaking or painting hassle...at a fraction of the cost of lead figures!

Each CARDBOARD HEROES figure is shown in both front and back views, and folds to form its own base (or you can use our optional plastic bases). Collect all the sets - and put a whole army in your pocket! They're perfect for travel and quick games, or for a whole campaign.

This is Traveller Set 2: Imperial Marines. The set contains 3 identical cards, each with 19 different figures: officers, sentries, troops in undress uniform, troops in camouflage battledress, and troops in Imperial Marine maroon urban battledress, plus extra weapon and equipment counters.

Also available now are Player Characters and Zhodani sets for Traveller. Watch for more releases soon, including Vargr and armored vehicles.

100398.name: Zhodani
100398.description:
User summary:

57 15mm full-color front and back sided folding miniatures plus a number of small counters with full color weapons.

From the Instruction sheet:

Full-color miniatures for all your games...with no bending, breaking or painting hassle...at a fraction of the cost of lead figures!

Each CARDBOARD HEROES figure is shown in both front and back views, and folds to form its own base (or you can use our optional plastic bases). Collect all the sets - and put a whole army in your pocket! They're perfect for travel and quick games, or for a whole campaign.

This is Traveller Set 3: Zhodani. The set contains 3 identical cards, each with 19 different figures: officers (nobles and intendants), troops (proles) in ordinary uniforms, troops in camouflage battledress, and battledress troops in standard Zhodani black. Also included: extra weapon/gear counters.

Also available now are Player Character and Imperial Marine sets for Traveller. New releases will include Vargr and armored vehicles.

100399.name: Escape
100399.description:
From the front cover:

The Adventure is designed for characters of virtually any background in the employ of a merchant company based in the Reavers' Deep sector. Characters should possess a mix of skills spanning many fields.

From the back cover:

Situation: Hopeless! Alone on an untamed world.... imprisoned by warrior Aslan .... the human expedition on Htalrea faces impossible odds as they strive to win free from their alien captors. It will take every bit of skill and luck the adventurers can muster to out fox the Aslan warriors and escape.

Escape is a folio adventure approved for use with Traveller, GDW's original role-playing game of Science-Fiction adventure in the far future. Written by J. Andrew Keith, Escape picks up where his earlier folio Trading Team (published by Marischal Adventures) left off.... and launches a new line of SEEKER folios that link together to form an ongoing Traveller campaign.

100409.name: Monster Vault: Threats to the Nentir Vale
rpghonor: 2012 ENnie for Best Monster/Adversary - Silver Winner
100409.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

Terrifying monsters and villains for your heroic- and paragon-tier campaign.

The Nentir Vale - a frontier land sheltered by mountains and strewn with abandoned farmsteads, ruined manors, and broken keeps - is the perfect base for any Dungeons & Dragons campaign.

Monster Vault: Threats to the Nentir Vale presents statistics, tactics, and lore for an array of new monsters that prowl the Nentir Vale, some of which trace their origins back to the earliest editions of the Dungeons & Dragons Roleplaying Game. Other entries focus on campaign villains present in the Nentir Vale region, among them the Iron Circle, the Tigerclaw Barbarians, the Raven Roost Bandits, and several new villainous groups introduced here for the first time.

The monsters and villains contained within are appropriate challenges for heroic- and paragon-tier characters and fit easily into any home campaign, as well as other Dungeons & Dragons published campaign settings. In addition to a 128-page book of ready-to-play monsters and villains, this product includes 8 die-cut sheets of card stock monster and villain tokens and a double-sided battle map featuring four different encounter locations you can use when running encounters.

100410.name: Dungeon Tiles: The Witchlight Fens
100410.description:
From the publisher's Website:

Illustrated cardstock terrain tiles for use with the Dungeons & Dragons Roleplaying Game.

This roleplaying game accessory gives Dungeon Masters an easy and inexpensive way to include great-looking terrain in their games. This set provides ready-to-use, configurable tiles with which to build exciting encounter locations. This particular set emphasizes swamp terrain and serves as an extension to the Dungeon Tiles Master Set: The Wilderness boxed set.

This accessory contains six double-sided sheets of illustrated, die-cut terrain tiles printed on heavy cardstock.

100412.name: It Came from the Desert (1992)
100412.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "It Came from the Desert", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

The TurboGrafx CD version was released in 1992. It was a CD-ROM based game that made use of full motion video with recorded sequences of live actors. There were also action sequences that used drawn graphical elements (not captured, as seen in games such as Mean Streets by Access Software). The side-scrolling action sequence consisted of the player battling ants in tunnels. The TurboGrafx CD version did reuse the graphical elements from the computer version for the overhead battle sequences, but not for any of the character conversation segments.

Unfortunately, this version was marred by poor quality of the video playback of the system, and the limitations of the game console hardware that resulted in side scrolling arcade sequences that were tacky in terms of gameplay. The acting in the video sequences was of B-movie quality by intention, keeping in-line with the source material that served as an inspiration for the game.

Taken from the manual:

The little desert town of Lovelock is in trouble. Atomic testing has created giant mutant ants lead by the Ant Queen of Badness... The Antmind.

As Dr. Horton Pangborne's assistant, you must find a way to stop the ants before they build an A-Bomb and wipe Lovelock off the map. The townfolks don't believe there's a problem and some of them are even under Antmind control.

Object of the Game:
Playing the role of Buzz Lincoln, high-school senior, locate the Queen's nest and destroy her before the Ants' atomic bomb is completed. Avoid being injured, captured or destroyed. Listen carefully for clues. Collect evidence that will convince the Air National Guard to join the fight against the Antmind.

Stages of the Game:
It Came From the Desert takes place over eight days. Each day is divided into 3 parts - morning, afternoon and evening. Each part contains up to 6 or more scenes.

100414.name: Heiankyo Alien
100414.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "Heiankyo Alien", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Heiankyo Alien (平安京エイリアン Heian-kyō Eirian) is a video game created by the University of Tokyo's Theoretical Science Group (TSG) in 1979. The game was originally developed as a personal computer game, and was first published by Denki Onkyō Corporation as an arcade game in January, 1980. The game has been ported to several other gaming systems since its original release.

The player controls a Heian period police officer (kebiishi) who must defend the capital city (Heian-kyō) from an alien invasion by digging holes in the ground and filling them back up after an alien falls inside. The player scores points for every alien trapped, and the quicker the hole is filled up after the alien falls in, the higher the amount of points are scored. The aliens increase in number as the levels progress, and they can escape from holes after a certain period of time elapses or if another alien passes above their hole. The player loses if they come in contact with an alien. There is a time limit for each level, and the number of aliens increases drastically when this limit is reached, essentially preventing the player from completing the level.

Meldac released a Game Boy version of the game in Japan and North America in 1990. This port includes a remake version where a new type of alien appears to chase after the player's character.

User Summary

Taken from the manual:

The time is 1,000 years ago, way back in the Heian Age. The peaceful city of Kyo is suddenly invaded by aliens. A kebiishi (knight of the past) is entrusted to defend the city. He decides to confront the terrible aliens in a bold plan to bury the dreaded beasts alive.

People are being horribly devoured bite by bite by the aliens as they ravages down Miyako Ooji (The city's main street). Without even a hinawaju (type of firearm) to shoot the aliens, the keibiishi has no choice but to try to bury the aliens alive. He sets himself to the task, digging a hole on the road where the aliens are headed.

Then he hides and waits. Should any alien fall into the hole, he must quickly bury it before it can climb back out. In this game, you are to play the role of the keibiishi trying to defend the city.

100415.name: GeoSafari World Challenge
100415.description:
This electronic talking quiz game challenges kids with fast-paced high tech fun! High quality digital Texas Instruments voice technology asks questions about world countries, rivers, mountains, landmarks and more. Over 7,500 intriguing questions! Unit updates scores and provides positive reinforcement.

Contents:

1 Electronic game unit features four light-up Play buttons for one to four players. Unit updates scores and provides positive reinforcement.

100416.name: Academe
100416.description:
Academe is a quick, cooperative, filler card game for 3 players: one Thinker, one Teacher and one Builder. The players must expend and earn Ideas, Knowledge and Material by building inventions. Possible inventions are determined by turning over cards in rounds, and the player must choose which invention to build in each turn. If, by the end of the three rounds of the game, the team has earned enough of these three commodities to build a University, they win the game.

Because it is non-competitive, it can also be easily played by fewer than 3 people, if one player wants to play more than one character. In addition, the commodity targets can be lowered to make the game easy to win, for young children.

100419.name: MiYu Magic Card Game
100419.description:
A card game based on the popular game MiYu.

Players collect elements of a magic circles by discarding sets of 3 cards. A set is made of 1 (out of 4) element, a Zodiac sign associated to that element and the corresponding stone.

The game includes joker cards that, when rubbed by a player, reveal a message as by magic!

100420.name: Roll and Score Bingo
100420.description:
Players roll 2 dice and try to match the sum of the dice in his bingo sheet (numbers 2-12). Player who fills his sheet first is the winner

Contents:

score pad,
2 dice,
cup

100421.name: Snag
100421.description: Players compete to accumulate the most tiles using a combination of memory, alertness and luck. When a 'Run' of 4 tiles in a row appears, the first to yell 'Snag!' is entitled to place them in his winnings pile. Players maneuver 80 wooden pieces on the board. Object of the game is outwit and outguess the opponents.

100422.description:
Publisher's Blurb

Munchkin is not a drinking game. Really.

But don't let that stop you from showing your love of Munchkin with the Munchkin 10th Anniversary Shot Glass. These 1.5 oz glasses are black with the Munchkin 10th Anniversary logo in gold. It's a treasure that any munchkin would be happy to find in his dungeon haul... especially since they come with a special rule.

Munchkin 10th Anniversary Shot Glass Rule

The Munchkin 10th Anniversary Shot Glass may be used in any Munchkin game or its sequels.

When fighting a monster on your turn, you may take one complete shot of Strength Potion* from the Munchkin 10th Anniversary Shot Glass to get a +10 combat bonus. You may do this as many times as you like during a game, but every drink of Strength Potion after the first costs you a level. You may only benefit from one Strength Potion per combat.


The owner of the Shot Glass is the sole judge of what liquid(s) will make up the Strength Potion.



Other

Part of the Munchkin series
100422.name: Munchkin 10th Anniversary Shot Glass
boardgameexpansion: The Good, the Bad, and the Munchkin

boardgamehonor: 2012 Golden Geek Best Thematic Board Game Nominee
100423.description:
Game description from the publisher:

It is 1926, and the museum's extensive collection of exotic curios and occult artifacts poses a threat to the barriers between our world and the elder evils lurking between dimensions. Gates to the beyond begin to leak open, and terrifying creatures of increasing strength steal through them. Animals, the mad, and those of more susceptible minds are driven to desperation by the supernatural forces the portals unleash. Only a handful of investigators race against time to locate the eldritch symbols necessary to seal the portals forever. Only they can stop the Ancient One beyond from finding its way to Earth and reducing humanity to cinders.

Elder Sign is a fast-paced, cooperative dice game of supernatural intrigue for one to eight players by Richard Launius and Kevin Wilson, the designers of Arkham Horror. Players take the roles of investigators racing against time to stave off the imminent return of the Ancient One. Armed with tools, allies, and occult knowledge, investigators must put their sanity and stamina to the test as they adventure to locate Elder Signs, the eldritch symbols used to seal away the Ancient Ones and win the game.

To locate Elder Signs, investigators must successfully endure Adventures within the museum and its environs. A countdown mechanism makes an Ancient One appear if the investigators are not quick enough. The investigators must then battle the Ancient One. A clever and thematic dice mechanism pits their exploration against monsters and the sheer difficulty of staying sane and healthy, all within the standard game duration of one to two hours.

Created for fans by fans, this issue of the Wayfinder fanzine includes dozens of articles designed to expand the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and the world of Golarion. Inside you will find original fiction, new races, monsters, recipes, poetry and this is just a small portion of what awaits you!

100425.name: Red Baron
100425.description:
Red Baron is a low complexity, quick playing board game of World War I air combat. This is not an aerial combat simulation by any means. It is a relatively simple "beer & pretzels" game in which the players use cards to fly their fighters, bombers, and balloons.

The game is two-dimensional (no altitude considerations) and features three aircraft types (fighters, bombers and balloons). Players use cards to maneuver their aircraft (one per card play) with the aim of collecting victory points by shooting down enemy aircraft, bombing ground targets (with bombers) or conducting aerial observation over no man's land (with balloons). The players each start with six aircraft but can vary the assortment in an effort to pursue differing victory strategies.

The game comes packaged in a ziploc bag that contains the 11" by 17" card-stock (unmounted) board, 38 playing pieces (counters), 28 cards and 4 pages of rules.

100426.description:
The Battle for Cyprus - 1941 is an expansion for Air Assault on Crete and depicts the proposed plan for a German airborne assault on the island of Cyprus in mid-1941.

This game uses the rules from Air Assault on Crete with variations and expansions. This expansion was original published in Avalon Hill The GENERAL Vol.18,No.3magazine. The map was included as an insert to the magazine and mounted counters were available via mail order from Avalon Hill.

100428.name: Asylum
100428.description:
from the back of the book

The first thing you remember is waking up in the back of a van. There are people with you, also in restraints. Men in white suits are driving you to an unknown location. Then you pass a sign post.

Who are you? How did you get here? Why are you here? Who are these people with you? Why are they treating you like this?

Welcome to Hofas Asylum - your own personal hell.

This adventure introduces new character types, special skills, equipment and new rules on madness and insanity.

100429.name: Mysterium
100429.description:
Taken from the manual:

Your life long fascination with alchemy is about to be tested. You have come to the famous alchemist Hermetrix and been accepted as his apprentice. The task of an alchemist is to magically convert metals and minerals into gold and other useful items. After a short introduction to alchemy, Hermetrix has sent you to the Mysterium to prove yourself. Here you must find your way through twisting halls created by the Arimasp, a race of giant ants who live in the Mysterium. You must use the pools of transformation with your knowledge of alchemy to create any item you will need. To pass the test, you must learn the nature of each metal and mineral, and the transforming powers of each process: fire, water, acid and mercury. When you have mastered alchemy you may succeed in the final test. You must rescue the giant ant civilization and Cadmia, the alchemist who tried before you.

100430.name: Dynasty Warriors 7
100430.description:
From the Game Box

Conquest Knows No Boundries.

Experience the thrill of taking on entire armies as one of many playable warriors from the Wei, Wu, Shu, and Jin Dynasties.

Lead your squad to victory in the face of insurmountable odds, as you realize your dream of reuniting ancient China.

100431.name: Wildcard Football
100431.description:
This football strategy game revolves around a pair of selector cups, one for each player. The cups are built into the thick gridiron board and function as dials that determine the play selected by each coach.

The outcome of each offensive play is determined by die rolls in the selector cups. The offensive team rolls for yardage gained. The defensive player rolls two dice that can generate random events like a fumble or a penalty.

Play follows the rules of football with punts, field goals, and every other element of the sport.

The board includes a sliding football marker and a matching first down marker that also slides up and down the field. There is a huge scoreboard plus the rulebook.

Published in 1978 by Wildcard, Inc.

100432.name: TT Races
100432.description:
This is a simple roll and move game of the TT Races on the Isle of Man. The players take turns rolling dice and moving around the board, a 'satellite photo' style representation of the TT Races course. At various points they encounter obstacles that may slow them down or speed them up. They may land on spaces that cause them to draw Race Situation or Pit Signal cards which can affect their progress positively or negatively.

The game components as listed on the rules card are:

Board (TT Course)
Eight playing pieces of different colours (small plastic motorcycles)
One Throwing/Equipment Holder Box
Two Dice
Once Dice Cup
Six sets of Lap Scoring Cards (each numbered 1 - 6)
Sixty-six Race Situation cards
Sixty-four Pit Signal cards

100433.name: The National Game of the Star-Spangled Banner
100433.description: An educational game based on an earlier British game. One of the first games published in the USA.

100436.description:
Unpack the whole cycling world on your table! Enter the trategies of the biggest cycling teams in a great family game Arrivée.

Compete in the stages for the jerseys of the best cyclist, World champion, best climber or best sprinter. The game realistically simulates all point and bonus awards of the major cycling races of the world. as you ride each stage, time is measured so that you can know what advantage or loss you have in comparison with your competitors. Your journey to victory can become complicated due to sudden weather changes, falls or defects, but team co-operation can help you back to the pack. Refresh your team and have the best performance with the use of a dice, cards and intuitive game mechanism.

Arrivée is the best simulation of cycling race stages in the world!
100436.name: Arrivée

100438.name: Chewy: Esc from F5
videogamepublisher: Blue Byte Software GmbH (Blue Byte Studio GmbH)
100438.description:
From the back of the box:

Welcome to the adventures and hilarious world of Chewy, the outrageous alien! This comical game puts you in amusing situations in an effort to help the prank-playing Chewy find the "Red Glump". Go ghost hunting, solve fascinating puzzles, shoot slime balls, fly space ships and get shrunk!

The fully digitized speech is filled with zany one-liners, humorous cracks and plenty of attitude! The game also offers a unique "cartoon" inspired setting, enhanced by richly colored graphics. The visually stunning atmosphere and entertaining circumstances, offers gamers a wacky cyber experience!

- Ghost hunting
- Numerous riddles
- Amazing depth and colorful graphics
- Digitized speech
- Fast paced story with hilarious gags
- 1 space & 4 earth scenarios
- Chewy gives you clues about how to win the game

100439.name: Demolition Girl
100439.description:
From the back of the box:

On the island of Minakojima a gigantic creature has appeared... and it's heading for Tokyo!

- The gigantic creature is Riho Futaba. In the game you will have to try to halt her advance with a series of targeted military actions. Carry out your duty on board fighter jets, helicopters and tanks!

- Play through 6 great action-packed combat missions.

- At the end of each mission you can check with quests you have completed, and if you manage to complete them all...

100440.name: F.I.L.O
100440.description:
This is game #6 in the Games on Half a Checkerboard Series.

F.I.L.O is a sowing game like those in the Mancala family. Unlike games normally found in the Mancala family, F.I.L.O uses a first in, last out (FILO) mechanism for sowing pieces on the board, which is the basis of its name. This mechanism, combined with the attributes of the 8x4 board, takes F.I.L.O in directions not normally seen with games in the Mancala family.

100441.name: Frontjammin'
100441.description:
This is #7 in the Games on a Half a Checkerboard Series. Frontjammin' is a game like Backgammon, with its own twists. It also includes a variant using a King piece, which gives the game a bit of a Chess flavor.

In the game, players will roll two dice. If they roll 5-6 on any of the two dice, that counts as a single die roll that a player picks (1-4). If players roll doubles of 1-4, they advance 4 pieces the same amount, if possible.

In addition, the game involves pieces being placed in columns and trapping their opponent's pieces. The smaller board also lends to an increased chance of a reversal of fortune.

100442.name: 2-5 Skidoo
100442.description:
This is game #8 in the Games on Half a Checkerboard Series.

2-5 Skidoo a press-your-luck game for 2 players on an 8x4 board, in the family of games that includes games like Can't Stop, Cosmic Wimpout, 500, Farkle, Ten Thousand, and Pass the Pigs. The name is derived from the phrase “23 skidoo”.

In this game, each of the 4 columns on the 4x8 board correspond to numbers 2-5. During a turn a player rolls 6 six-sided dice (numbered 1-6). They pick three to add up, to beat a target number (this is either zero on their first roll, or what their last total was). The players then take one of the remaining 3 dice and apply it to one of their columns.

If a player can't apply a die to advance one of their pieces, or don't beat their target number, all advancement resets.

Play continues until a player gets all four of their pieces off the board.

100443.name: Melting Ice Floes
100443.description:
This is #9 game in the Games on Half a Checkerboard Series.

In Melting Ice Floes, players attempt to eliminate their opponent's pawn or ice floe pieces from the board. As the game progresses, the board shrinks and players may face a situation where half of the board suddenly disappears on them, leaving them with every increasing dangerous situations from which to escape. This game comes with variant rules to support 3 and 4 players.

100444.name: Largo Winch: Empire Under Threat
100444.description:
From the back of the box:

Become Largo Winch, the billionaire in blue jeans, and discover the dangerous and intriguing world of business in this adventure without limits.

- Piracy cases and a murder shake up the W Group.
- Travel to Mexico, New York, Sardinia, Sarajevo and Russia on the trail of your enemies.
- Confront your enemies using all your combat skills.
- Explore, infiltrate and solve mysteries to uncover the plot against you.

100445.name: Knight Barricades
100445.description:
This is game #10 in the Games on Half a Checkerboard Series

This game is in the family of games that includes Amazons, and Slimetrail where the object is to cause one's opponent to not be able to move due to the number of spaces available on the board gets reduced as players play the game. Each player has a piece that has a move like a Chess Knight and also put down barricades to restrict movement. From these two elements comes the name of the game.

100446.name: Legends of Wrestling
100446.description:
From the back of the box:

The Mania is about to begin all over again.

Grapple with 42 of the greatest wrestlers of all time including: Hulk Hogan, Bret "Hitman" Hart, Jerry "The King" Lawler, Terry Funk, The Road Warriors, Jimmy "Superfly" Snuka, Rob Van Dam, Ted Dibiase, George "The Animal" Steele and many more!

Revolutionary Intermediate Start Position system allows gamers to link moves together for lethal single-button combinations and superior gaming!

First-ever Create-A-Legend allows for the deepest wrestler customization in the history of wrestling vidoe games!

Never before in-depth career guidance by wrestling's greatest managers: Captain Lou Albano and the "Mouth of the South" Jimmy Hart.

All-new interactive wrestler entrances with announcer introductions, crowd responses and authentic grappler taunts!

100447.description:
Sherlock is a cooperative memory game in which players try to unmask the culprit by collecting cards that exonerate the remaining suspects.

To set up the game, thirty cards are shuffled and placed face-down in a 6x5 grid. Each card shows one of six witnesses on its back and a witness viewing one of the five suspects on its front. On a turn, the active player reveals two cards in the grid. If they match, the player then turns over a third card. If all three cards show show the same suspect, the cards are collected and placed face-up next to the grid. In all other cases, that player turns the cards face-down once again, then flips over one of the ten timing cards, each showing Sherlock's nemesis Moriarty.

If all ten Moriarty cards are flipped, then the players lose the game. If, however, the players remove cards from the grid until only three remain, they have successfully identified the culprit – that is, the suspect who remains – and can claim victory.

A competitive variant is included in the rules which have players competing to collect witness cards. An additional variant rewards points to the player who holds (or doesn't hold) the suspect eventually identified as the culprit.

The Sherlock box also includes eight bonus cards, a new dinosaur and action cards for a fifth player for Ilopeli's Jurassik.
100447.name: Sherlock
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast 004 – Essen 2015 Diary!

100448.name: Shopping, el juego de la moda
100448.description: The goal of the game is to get ten clothing and fashion items, by answering questions related to the fashion and glamour world. When you annswer correctly, you get money, with which to buy the items you need. After several rounds, the final phase of the game consists in a final question. Depending on how good your item selection was, the answer will be easier or more difficult.

100449.name: Invocateurs
100449.description:
In a fantasy world, conflicts are merely a souvenir...
Wars are solved by powerful summoners fighting in a dedicated arena.
Each player incarnate a summoner that will try to defeat its opponents by unleashing powerful creatures to wreck havoc in the rival teams.
Summon creatures, gather magical rings and gain new spells while your opponents are doing the same.
Defeat creatures to increase your experience and improve your abilities.

During his turn, each player can choose two actions (possibly more later in the game) among five (movement, attack, search for a ring, summon, heal).
Moving will allow the player to explore new area of the game, increasing the amount of mana available and making ring search possible, or get closer to enemy's force.
Every aspect of the game is solved with dice (except for summoning creatures).
A player win when he annihilate all the other summoners.

This is a skirmish game blending strategy and chance, with a strong fantasy theme.

100450.name: Secouris le jeu de cartes
100450.description:
Really close to happy families or games of trades, the goal is to collect a complete set of cards.

the theme of the game is first aid and families are related to to it (hazardous Products, first aid kit, holiday hazards, ect..)

after asking for a card, you need to answer the question on the card to win it.

The first player to collect a complete set win the game.

100452.description:
Dept. 13 is a game in which players use the Steel and Glory System to battle the creatures created by Occult Nazi Forces. Dept. 13 is a secret government agency dedicated to fighting supernatural forces. The game includes super spies (who are identified only by one letter initials), Nazi zombies, ghouls, mad scientists, and themes of occult horror. As with the other games in the S&G system, the battles are very quick and can be fought one-on-one or with players each controlling large groups. Each character has several unique stats, including their fighting ability, and the cost to hire them as a mercenary into your fighting force.

Each turn, players activate a character which can take up to two actions, including fight, move, rest, climb, or stand/go prone. Characters can attack enemies that are one square away for melee attack or may use ranged attack for enemies further away. Fighting is based on power of the weapon, power of the character's attack strength, and power of the enemies defense strike. The hit points are calculated via 2D6 - the power of the attack. For example, if an attack had a total strength of 6 and a 10 was rolled, the attack would have a power of 4. Victory is achieved by having a character remain on a certain part of the board for three complete uninterrupted turns.
100452.name: Dept. 13

100453.name: Daedalian Opus
100453.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "Daedalian Opus", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Daedalian Opus (冒険!パズルロード Bōken! Pazuru Rōdo, Adventure! Puzzle Road) was a puzzle game for the Game Boy released in June of 1990. It was one of the few games produced by the little-known software company Vic Tokai. Cover illustration by Lawrence Fletcher. The name of the game was inspired by Daedalus, the mythical character of Greek legend who created the labyrinth.

Gameplay

The game is essentially a series of 36 jigsaw puzzles with Tetris-like pieces known as pentominos that must be assembled into a specific shape. The puzzles start off with rectangular shapes and simple solutions, but the puzzles quickly grow more complex, with odder shapes like a rocket ship, a gun, and even enlarged versions of some of the pentominoes themselves. Each level is timed, and once the timer is started it cannot be stopped until the level is finished. One starts off the game with only three pentomino pieces, and at the completion of each early level, a new piece is awarded to the player. At the final level, the player is given the 2x2 square O tetromino and must complete an 8x8 square puzzle.

After completing each level, the player was given a password to access that level at a later time. Interestingly, each password was a common English four-letter word, so that by guessing common four-letter words, players could potentially access levels they had not actually reached by playing the game.

From the manual:

In the World of Daedalus there are puzzles houses on each of the 42 islands of this very puzzling land. On the first island there are no bridges and no ships. When you enter the puzzle house on this island you will find 3 Daedalian blocks. Your task is to fill up the frame in front of you with the blocks. There can be no space remaining! When this has been done, a bridge will appear, and you can go on to the next island.

However, you are in an apprentice stage until you get up to a point where you are using 12 blocks. While in this stage, you will find three blocks at the first island. When the sprite appears over the bridge, you will get another block and go on to next island by passing through the puzzle house. Only when you have gotten by your apprentice stage with 12 blocks, does the real game begin!

You will encounter many different types of frames. Some will be very challenging, but don't give up! When you have mastered all the puzzles on all islands up to 41, you will be confronted by island 42, where your final task awaits you. Here you will be presented with 13 blocks. Good luck!

100454.description: Dept. 13 part 2: Lincoln High is the first expansion to Dept. 13. This expansion adds Gremlins and many new powers to battle against the supernatural Nazi creatures.
100454.name: Dept. 13 part 2: Lincoln High

100455.description: Dept. 13 part 3: Monster Hunters is the second expansion to Dept. 13. This expansion adds Giant Bugs, Dogs, Army Personnel, and many new powers to battle against the supernatural Nazi creatures.
100455.name: Dept. 13 part 3: Monster Hunters

100456.description: Dept. 13 part 4: Armageddon’s Dance is the third expansion to Dept. 13. This expansion provides a set of campaign rules with seven scenarios. It links all other games in the Dept. 13 series together and each is required to play. The results of each scenario are carried forward to the next scenario and can drastically affect the future events. This expansion adds new locations to the game as well, such as a Connecticut Mental Hospital where the Nazis are using the patients for bizarre experiments.
100456.name: Dept. 13 part 4: Armageddon's Dance

100457.description: Steel & Glory 8: Road to Glory is the seventh expansion to the Steel and Glory games. This expansion adds mounted units, new terrain, and Squire and Barbarian characters to the game.
100457.name: Steel & Glory 8: Road to Glory

100458.description:
Cave Girl takes the S&G combat system to prehistoric times. In this game, a cave girl named Sharr must compete for her existence with dinosaurs. each character in the game comes with several cards designating their fighting abilities which can be used in battle. There are several scenarios included with the game.

Each turn, players activate a character which can take up to two actions, including fight, move, rest, climb, or stand/go prone. Characters can attack enemies that are one square away for melee attack or may use ranged attack for enemies further away. Fighting is based on power of the weapon, power of the character's attack strength, and power of the enemies defense strike. The hit points are calculated via 2D6 - the power of the attack. For example, if an attack had a total strength of 6 and a 10 was rolled, the attack would have a power of 4. Victory is achieved by having a character remain on a certain part of the board for three complete uninterrupted turns.
100458.name: Cave Girl

100459.description: Comic Book Heroes 2 is the first expansion to Comic Book Heroes. This expansion comes with a new hero called Night Stalker and a new villain called Brute. There are 18 cards for both which add many new play elements to the base game.
100459.name: Comic Book Heroes 2

100460.description: Comic Book Heroes 3 is the second expansion to Comic Book Heroes. This expansion comes with a new hero called Miss America and a new villain called Master Mind. There are 18 cards for both which add many new play elements to the base game.
100460.name: Comic Book Heroes 3

100461.description: Comic Book Heroes 4 is the third expansion to Comic Book Heroes. This expansion comes with a new hero called Iron Eagle and a new villain called Doctor Death. There are 18 cards for both which add many new play elements to the base game.
100461.name: Comic Book Heroes 4

100463.description: Monster Bash 3: Psychos and Cosmics is the second expansion to Monster Bash: Bloods and Lupines. This expansion adds insane clowns, psychotic children, and other strange creatures to the base game. New scenarios are added that allow the monsters to fight one on one or in large groups. Each monster has a collection of cards that list fight abilities and special powers that are used in battles.
100463.name: Monster Bash: Psychos and Cosmics

100465.name: NHL Big League Manager: Junior Edition
100465.description:
Among the new features: player cards featuring NHL teams which allow Junior GM's to earn extra points by matching three or five of a kind ( from the same team). This game was also where we first developed the simplified scoring system which we liked so much, we used it for the Platinum Edition.
Junior General Managers draft players, makes trades and can even grab a free agent from rival General Manager. Finally, the perfect board game for young hockey fans!

The object of the game is to build the strongest team of players best able to win hockey games all while balancing the difficult task of being a general manager. Your team is then pitted against your opponents. The winner of 5 games wins the game.

100466.name: NHL Breakaway
100466.description:
NHL Breakaway is a new and exciting action packed 2 player strategy card game. You and your opponent draw from the deck of cards placed between you. When you go to draw cards from the pile, you will draw Player Cards (they represent the players on your team), Instant Replay Cards (intangibles which
may momentarily affect a player or team’s performance) or Slapshot Cards (cards that have a more permanent effect on your team and the overall game).
With the help of your Player Cards and your other cards, try to win Possession of the puck during the face-off and then to go on the Attack to score more goals than your opponent over the course of 3 periods of play.

100467.name: NHL Slapshot: Western Conference Pack
100467.description:
Expansion for the NHL Slapshot Card Game
Adding new carddeck with players from Western Conference.

100468.name: NHL Slapshot: Eastern Conference Pack
100468.description:
Expansion for the NHL Slapshot Card Game
Adding new carddeck with players from Eastern Conference.

100469.name: SOS Jungle
100469.description:
Progressive game with a favourite theme, where children help baby animals find their parents in a jungle with look-alike paths riddled with obstacles.
Games begins with the closed board. Players roll 2 dice (number die and color die) and move on the board, open the tokens if it match with color die until they are able to go through the whole jungle and bring the lost baby animals safely to their mothers!

Contents:

1 colourful game board
2 big foam dice,
35 tokens,
6 large wooden markers

100470.name: Killer Party
100470.description:
Your best friends are getting married, you are going to a family party, you are organising a friends weekend... And what if you spiced things up a bit by getting all these partygoers to kill each other?

The organiser gives everyone an assignment and a target amongst the attendees and gets ready to count the dead... As soon as a killer has accomplished his mission, he takes the assignment and the target of the dead person for himself. At the end of the game, the best serial killer and the last man standing will be rewarded!

The goal of Killer Party is to be the one person to succeed in the hunt, but all the others are trying to stab you in the back...

100471.name: TROLLBURGER
100471.description:
The players are gnomes in the employ of a troll on a burger restaurant. The troll told them: "One of you will be fired at the end of the day; the one with worst cash!". The troll will take the customer’s orders and he hope the gnomes make their work fast, very fast; because if they delay an order, the customer (another troll, usually!) will get angry and leave the restaurant without paying.

GAME COMPONENTS

15 order cards
95 product cards
12 counters: 3 green, 3 blue, 3 yellow and 3 red
Rules

GAME PLAY

"Trollburger" is a 2-player card game. At the start of the turn, the starting player turn over the top deck card and show the number on it.

If that number is equal or higher thant the number of order cards on table, another order card is drawn and placed on the table.

Then the starting player choose to perform one of 4 actions on his turn. He can make that action as many times as the number shown at the start of the turn:

-Take cards from the product deck
-Search a card from the product deck
-Discard cards from the hand
-Place products on the table to build a burger

Then, he can choose to deliver a burger to the customers. The player can deliver an incomplete burger, in the hope that the customer does not realize.

Next, the other player takes his turn, using the same number;
and at last he becomes the starting player for the next turn.

If at any time, a 5th order has to be added on tha table, the older order on table is discarded (and any player who was working on it, loses his product cards).

GOAL

When a player devilers an order he takes that order card.
The game ends if 4 orders are discarded or the last order card is drawn.
At the end of the game, each player add the victory points of his order cards. The player with more victory points is the winner.

(Here you can find all the files to print & play your own Trollburger).


Los jugadores son gnomos que trabajan para un troll en una hamburgueseria. El troll les ha comunicado que uno de ellos sera despedido al final del dia; aquel que aporte menos al negocio. El troll es el encargado de coger los pedidos de los clientes y espera que los gnomos hagan su trabajo rapido, muy rapido; pues si se retrasan en entregar un pedido, el cliente (normalmente otro troll!!) se va a enfadar y se ira del restaurante si haber consumido.

COMPONENTES DEL JUEGO

15 cartas de pedidos
95 cartas de productos
12 contadores: 3 verdes, 3 azules, 3 amarillos y 3 rojos
Reglas

EL JUEGO

"Trollburger" es un juego de cartas para 2 jugadores. Al principio del turno, el jugador inicial gira la carta superior de la baraja y muestra el número que aparece en ella.

Si ese numero es igual o mayor que el numero de cartas de pedidos en la mesa, aparece una nueva carta de pedido y se añade al centro de la mesa.

Después el jugador inicial elige cual de 4 posibles acciones quiere realizar en su turno. Podra hacer esa accion tantas veces como el numero que se ha mostrado al principio del turno:

-Coger cartas de la baraja de productos
-Buscar una carta en la baraja de productos
-Descartar cartas de la mano
-Colocar productos en la mesa para elaborar una hamburguesa

Despues, puede elegir entregar una hamburguesa a los clientes. El jugador puede entregar una hamburguesa que no este acabada, con la esperanza de que el cliente no se de cuenta.

Acto seguido, el otro jugador realiza su turno, usando el mismo numero; y al final se convierte en el jugador inicial para el siguiente turno.

Si en algun momento, se debe anadir un 5º pedido a la mesa, el pedido mas antiguo que hubiera en la mesa se descarta (y cualquier jugador que estuviera elaborando ese bocata, pierde los productos que tuviera en la mesa).

OBJETIVO

Cuando un jugador entrega un pedido se queda esa carta de pedido.
El juego finaliza si 4 pedidos se han descartado o si se muestra el ultimo pedido del mazo.
Al final de la partida, cada jugador suma los puntos de victoria de sus cartas de pedidos. El jugador con mas puntos de victoria es el ganador.

(Aqui puedes encontrar todos los archivos necesarios para imprimir y jugar a tu propio Trollburger)

100472.name: QWOP
100472.description:
From the intro screen:

You are Qwop, our small nation's sole representative at the Olympic Games.
Use the QWOP keys to move your legs.
Ideally you will run 100 metres...
...but our training program was under-funded.
Remember, it's not about whether you win or lose.

100473.description:
String Railway: Transport is a follow-up game to String Railway, a train game in which the play area is created by placing varying lengths of colored string representing different types of terrain. The board is initially seeded with all the stations (unlike in String Railway) placed randomly inside the boundary string and filled with two goods cubes.

Each turn, players must place one string that connects stations. Then players have a number of action points to use. Players start with a 3 AP locomotive, and can upgrade to better locomotives that provide up to 6 AP per turn. Action points are used to moving goods cubes (1 AP to move from station to station). If a cube reaches a station of the same colour as the cube itself, the cube is then scored.

White cubes are special long distance cubes. Players have mission cards that show three stations in particular order. In order to fulfill the mission, the player must move a long-distance cube through the stations in right order. The reward depends on how many stations player moves the cube through. Unfulfilled mission is worth -2. Moving the cube through one station gets rid of the penalty. Two stations gets rid of the penalty and gives the player the white cube, which is scored as a wild cube. Three stations scores 5 points on top of that.

After five rounds, the cubes are scored. Each set of five cubes of different colours is worth 15 points, 4-cube sets are 10 points, 3-cube sets are 6 points, 2-cube sets are 3 points and remaining single cube sets give 1 point each. White wild cubes can be very useful at this point. Unfulfilled missions are -2 points, while perfectly fulfilled missions are +5 points.

In addition of moving cubes, action points can be used for upgrading locomotives and replenishing goods cubes. Collected goods cubes can be discarded to gain AP. Players can also draw new mission cards and each player has a personal station they can place on board at some point in game.

String Railway: Transport, with a playing time of approx. 15 minutes per player, differs from the original game by adding cargo delivery and removing the values of stations. Transport is an individual game, not an expansion. The games are not compatible: you can't play String Railway with the components of Transport (the stations are different and there's no river).
100473.name: String Railway: Transport

100475.name: Treasure Isle
100475.description:
Before beginning the search for treasure, the player first creates a customizable avatar. This avatar is much like that of FarmVille's avatar series. There are many islands to travel to for treasure. You can also customize your own island, such as add furniture like chairs, huts, plants and even expand the size of the island, similar to the farm space on FarmVille.

Like other games on Facebook, It is a great benefit to have "Neighbors" who can send you gifts. On many of the higher level islands, you must open gates which require certain colored gems (blue, purple, green, orange, red) to open, which you can only get from (currently one) a tree on your own island (but this is only one random colored tree), through random events from digging (receive only a single random gem, but you can share the gems you find with friends), or by requesting friends to send you some.

On each island, there are a certain amount of "Treasures" which contain objects that make up collections. When a collection is completed, the player will receive a reward in the form of money.

Source: Wikipedia, "Treasure Isle (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

100476.name: Millionaire City
100476.description:
Welcome to Millionaire City, where you can become a powerhouse CEO and watch the money roll in. Build your monopoly from the ground up by creating luxurious houses, crowded commercial skyscrapers, gorgeous decorations and unique world wonders. Make smart investments, take risks, care for your properties, and watch your company grow!

Features:
- Earn your riches as you build your company from the ground up as the CEO
- Purchase property, build houses, and sign contracts to help your company grow
- Complete missions to earn more and get hours of entertainment
- Discover a wide range of luxurious items in the marketplace
- Visit your friends’ to collect rent and see who’s got the most prosperous city

Source: The Developer Website.

100477.name: Vegas City
100477.description:
Roll them dice! Make it big as a casino magnate of your very own Las Vegas strip. Watch the neon signs light up with your name as you build your entertainment capital of the world by creating luxurious hotels casinos, golf resorts and more. You run the show in Vegas City, where fun and fortune await.

Features:
• Hit the jackpot as you build your own Las Vegas strip
• Build up to 16 hotel casinos, including Golf Resorts, Royal Casinos, Tropical Deluxe and more to create your entertainment capital of the world
• Reserve your rooms for tourists, gamblers, honeymooners, rock stars and more. The bigger the guest, the higher the returns.
• Add animated fountains, lit up palm trees, and other decorations to make your customers pay more for their stay.
• Complete missions to earn your income and get hours of fun entertainment
• Visit your friends and help them with their entertainment empire or become business partners to earn more

Source: The Developer Website.

100478.name: Hollywood City
100478.description:
Lights, camera, action! Make it big as a movie mogul and lead your very own Entertainment Empire. Watch the skies light up with your name as you build your media paradise by creating movie studios for horror, drama, comedy and more. You run the show in Hollywood City, where fame and fortune await!

Features
- Become rich and famous as you build your own Entertainment Empire
- Build movie studios for horror, drama, comedy, and more. What genre will you specialize in?
- Sign production contracts to film TV Commercials, Feature Films, Music Videos and more
